title: Professional Development Course for Mathematics Instructional Designers Based on Communities of Practice (CoP)

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with foundational mathematics instructional design theories and tool utilization
context.additional_context: Professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields develop mathematical instructional design competencies through collaborative learning in VR-based simulation environments.

learning_goals: Through community of practice (CoP) activities, learners can compare and analyze at least three types of mathematics instructional design models to select context-appropriate strategies
Over 80% of problems encountered during VR-based mathematics simulation design can be resolved through collaborative learning with CoP members
Mathematics instructional design portfolios can be improved at least twice by incorporating formative assessment feedback
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
